title: Course Prerequisites Table:
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {10076=North Dakota State University, a land-grant institution, was founded in 1890. Courses for a two-year program in pharmacy were initiated in 1902. Since then, courses and requirements have expanded to the present entry-level Pharm.D. program. The College also offers M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in pharmaceutical sciences.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {6165=We will accept PCAT scores from the time period of July 2012 to November 2015., 4694=All courses must be completed with at least a grade of "C."  Selected core courses, indicated by an asterisk (*) must be completed by the end of fall semester prior to the December 31 deadline date to apply to the pharmacy program.  Remaining courses, which are required and listed in the pre-pharmacy curriculum, MUST be completed by the end of spring term.}
textBeforeTable: Applicants must successfully complete ALL course prerequisites by the end of the: Spring 2016 term Total number of basic science college SEMESTER HOURS that must be completed prior to matriculation: 42 Total number of college SEMESTER HOURS that must be completed prior to matriculation: 76 Program Prerequisites ↑  Ratio of applications received to the number of first-year students enrolled, excluding transfer students entering other than the first year of your program: 1.18:1 Age RANGE of entering students, excluding transfer students entering other than the first year of your program: N/A Previous college experience prior to enrolling in the school/college of pharmacy: 3 or more years, no degree (>60 sem hrs) Minimum composite PCAT score considered: N/A Minimum prerequisite GPA considered: 3.0 Minimum overall GPA considered: 3.0 Number of TRANSFER seats available for fall 2016 entering class: N/A Number of OUT-OF-STATE seats available for fall 2015 entering class: N/A Number of IN-STATE seats available for fall 2015 entering class: N/A Is preference given to in-state applicants vs. out-of-state applicants? Yes Estimated number of students to be interviewed: 110-120 Estimated average GPA of accepted students: 3.58 Estimated percent of females in 2015 entering class: 58% Estimated percent of males in 2015 entering class: 42% Estimated number of out-of-state applicants accepted: 40 Estimated number of transfer applicants accepted: N/A Estimated number of early assurance students advancing to the professional program: N/A Estimated fall 2015 entering class size including early assurance and transfer seats: 85
textAfterTable: Additional Information:  All courses must be completed with at least a grade of "C."  Selected core courses, indicated by an asterisk (*) must be completed by the end of fall semester prior to the December 31 deadline date to apply to the pharmacy program.  Remaining courses, which are required and listed in the pre-pharmacy curriculum, MUST be completed by the end of spring term. Supplemental Application ↑  Supplemental Application required? We are not a participating PharmCAS institution Obtaining the Supplemental Application:  http://www.ndsu.edu/pharmacy">www.ndsu.edu/pharmacy Tests ↑  PCAT required? Yes The oldest PCAT considered: July 2012 Details:  We will accept PCAT scores from the time period of July 2012 to November 2015. Note: select PharmCAS Code 104 to report PCAT scores directly to PharmCAS.  TOEFL® required? No Note: select code 8246 to report TOEFL scores directly to PharmCAS.  Experience ↑  Is health care-related experience required? Not required but recommended Residency ↑  Is proof of state residency required? Yes
